resources.string:
The goal of the players in checkers is to cut down all of the opponents checkers or create such a situation that the opponent has no more moves.

 Checkers are played sequentially, one move at a time on black squares. The game is started by whites (unless otherwise agreed upon) and goes only diagonally, one square at a time (this is how ordinary checkers, not turned into queens, walk).

 The opponents checker is cut by jumping over it, the cut is mandatory and can only be done forward(depending on the set rules of the game).

 several crossings can be done during one move, if after jumping over a checker you end up in a square next to another crossed checker. A checker that has reached the end line ("Kings row") turns into a queen, which is given additional powers - it can walk back and forth one square at a time (also depending on the set rules of the game). 

 A checker can also turn into a queen during crossing, if it is on the end line during one of the crossing stages.
Select the board model you want:
Are you sure you want to surrender ?
The number is bigger then 30 or lower then 5
